text.tspan: If the Blattas believe they are at a
disadvantage against their opponent, they will
choose to retreat and avoid engagement. They
understand their limitations strongly and are
unwilling to risk their members' lives
needlessly. Even in unfavorable battle
conditions, they can minimize casualties and
prioritize the safety of their group.
Blattas is a group that relies on surprise
attacks to compensate for their low
combat power. They mainly target
untrained groups and use pre-war firearms
as their weapons. However, not all group
members are equipped with firearms due
to a lack of weapons, further diminishing
their fighting ability.
The orphans highly value Lahar's leadership skills but may become rebellious if
his decisions don't align with their expectations. The majority of Blattas members
are teenagers who are impulsive and don't think about long-term consequences,
which makes them difficult to manage.
Blattas have grown their group to nearly 100 thanks to Lahar's ability
to locate water sources. Instead of wandering through the wilderness,
Lahar realized that targeting and attacking water sources where other
survivors gathered was more effective. As a result, the group has
survived through plundering and has no permanent residence.
Lahar has developed survival
skills, including the ability to
conserve resources and survive
in confined spaces, through his
experiences in the cave.
He also learned how to take
the lives of others to stay.
Using these principles, he leads
a small group through the
wilderness by stealing from
other survivors and
distributing the items among
his "family."
Lahar survived the
nuclear winter in a
cave full of corpses
and a few children.
They discovered their
identity through the
cave's totem and the
hieroglyphics written
on the wall.
Blattas is a group of orphans who will do
anything to survive. The group's name, which
means desert cockroach, reflects their leader
Lahar's belief that survival is the only motivation
in an apocalyptic world.
Lahar formed the group Blattas
in the early days of the post-war
when many wandering orphans
had no food, water, or shelter in
the wasteland. Most of these
children were likely to die in
the desert or grassland, but
Lahar brought them together
and gave them a chance to
survive and thrive.
The name Blattas was chosen to
symbolize their new beginnings
and the hope for a better life.
Their determination and willingness to fight
bare-handed make them a formidable force,
even for the empire. However, it would be a
tough challenge to face them head-on.
The Caballeros are known for their
impressive fighting skills and commitment
to justice.
However, they only see the Fidelian
Empire as their enemy and view all other
groups as needing enlightenment. Despite
this, they are willing to fight for their
family and for vengeance.
While their primary weapon is firearms,
they are also ready to use other weapons
if necessary. Despite the post-war era's
focus on guns, the Caballeros prioritize
aesthetics over practicality.
The Caballeros organization values symbolism and can
often be found near crumbling cathedrals or cemeteries.
They travel on fast motorcycles and cars decorated with
European knightly designs and usually wear
anachronistic iron armor.
As such, they are unwilling to form
equal relationships with other factions
and will fiercely attack those who try,
even if they are not affiliated with the
empire.
The Caballeros work as a private security force in their
territory, similar to the Japanese Yakuza, who were
connected to local authorities or civilians in the pre-war
period. However, this does not mean that the Caballeros
see all other groups as equals; instead, they view
themselves as the sole source of justice and protection.
The Caballeros are an anti-imperial
army that does not seek conflict with
non-imperial civilians. Instead, they
have a special relationship with nearby
survivor groups, offering protection
from the Fidelian Empire, desert
raiders, and other looters in the
wilderness.
The Caballeros is an organization
led by Morales Fiago, a Spanish-
American, that was formed in the
aftermath of the nuclear winter.
While the Fidelian Empire views
the Caballeros as gangsters, they
see themselves as the guardians of
justice who stand against the
unjust empire.
One major drawback is that replacing their
troops is almost impossible when they suffer
losses on the battlefield. This is because
Zaikasha comprises soldiers with unique
individual abilities who were primarily trained
while in the empire.
Essentially, if even one member of Zaikasha is
lost, it leads to irreparable and permanent
weakening of the unit.
Zaikasha is a specialized unit designed for
missions requiring high organizational
combat power, such as infiltrating enemy
lines and assassinating key figures.
While they are individually skilled
fighters, their abilities are multiplied when
they work together as a group. Zaikasha
comprises soldiers with unique individual
skills primarily trained in the empire.
Rio is careful with issuing orders, as the members of
Zaikasha are expected to follow every one of his
commands, even if it may put their lives at risk.
Despite being free to express their opinions and
disagree with Rio, they still follow his orders without
question.
The Resistance, led by Rio, establishes shelters in abandoned
buildings in the desert and works to gain more resources
through negotiations with other groups.
They have a military-style plan for securing resources and
managing tasks such as food procurement and shelter security,
and they may take on mercenary-like missions at times.
Rio was made the
organization's leader due to his
charisma, which inspired many
members of his direct unit to
follow him and join the
Resistance.
However, he cannot handle all
decision-making independently,
so the teams under his
command are divided into
smaller platoons to distribute
his responsibilities.
However, Jake’s plan of running the empire was far from what Rio
envisioned. Disagreeing with Jake's approach to leading the
kingdom, Rio gathered his loyal followers and fled to create the
Resistance group.
Rio Crassus, a former officer in the
Fidelian Empire, founded the unit.
Crassus, a young and talented
soldier, played a crucial role in the
early days of the empire through his
exceptional tactical command and
strategic planning.
The Zaikasha unit is an elite unit
of the Fidelian Empire,
comprised of soldiers who have
undergone rigorous training to
carry out specialized missions. As
a result, each member is skilled
and has experience in their
particular role within the unit.
